document.description: I switched my order to breaded chicken breast with ... processed chicken like you would see in fast food restaurant ... was so awful I couldn't force myself to eat ...

Back to THE DOG Bar&Grille THE DOG Bar&Grille: Restaurant Reviews 3522 Del Prado Blvd S , Cape Coral , FL 33904 239-541-8304 Website Got a photo? Add it. Ranked #61 of 153 restaurants in Cape Coral 14 Reviews Price range: $4 - $15 Cuisines: American, Hamburgers, Healthy, Seafood, Vegetarian Good for: Families with children, Bar scene, Large groups, Outdoor seating Dining options: Lunch Restaurant details Good for: Families with children, Bar scene, Large groups, Outdoor seating Dining options: Lunch Update restaurant details Write a Review 14 reviews from our community 64% Recommend Excellent 3 Very good 6 Average 3 Poor 1 Terrible 1 Rating summary Food Service Value Atmosphere 14 reviews sorted by Date Rating TerPorrino Cape Coral, Florida Reviewer 4 reviews Reviews in 2 cities 3 helpful votes “Inconsistent restaurant” Reviewed September 2, 2011 My husband and I used to go to First Round Draft in Cape Coral pretty regularly and really enjoyed it a lot. However, First Round had a fire and they have been closed for several months while repairs were being made. We often see advertisements for the First Round Draft suggesting that customers visit their other restaurant, The Dog, while repairs were underway, so we finally tried it out.
The outside area is very welcoming, and the interior was warm and inviting as well. It is painted and styled in a very modern, adult oriented fashion. The walls are covered with prints of dogs, and the menu, in keeping with the dog theme, is categorized by"tailwaggers","ruffage","dog gone good sandwiches", etc.
We ordered wings as an appetizer, and they were quite good. Then our salads came out. My husband was content with his salad, but the lettuce in mine was brown around the edges. Our waitress, Serena, was very knowledgeable about the menu, and when my husband ordered Pork Osso Bucco, she said that was a good choice. I originally asked for the Pot Roast in Brown Gravy and inquired if the carrots and potatoes could be swapped out for mashed potatoes. Serena said she could ask, but the dish ingredients were all cooked together so I wouldn't be getting the full serving. I switched my order to breaded chicken breast with mashed potatoes&gravy. When we dine at First Round Draft, I always order the Fried Chicken Breast with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy, which I love, and I was expecting the same type of food from The Dog. My entree arrived with two large golden triangles and a scoop of mashed potatoes with gravy in a little bowl. It appeared to be straight out of an elementary school cafeteria. The mashed potatoes were cold, and the chicken looked just like two giant chicken nuggets. I cut one open and it was clearly over-processed chicken like you would see in fast food restaurant nuggets or out of a box of frozen chicken. I took one bite of the chicken and I was done. It was so awful I couldn't force myself to eat it. My husband's Pork Osso Bucco, however, was tender and delicious. The meat fell off the bone and was flavored perfectly, and was served on a tasy bed of rice.
It was bizarre that my husband's meal was so good while mine was so disappointing. I thought maybe I shouldn't have been surprised, as macaroni and cheese was an optional side dish.....maybe I was served a kid's meal by mistake? The chicken was nothing like the meals at First Round Draft.
Another waitress took our plates away when we were done, and a few minutes later Serena came out and said she noticed I didn't eat the chicken and wanted to know if there was a problem. I said it was nasty and I couldn't eat it. Serena offered to bring me something else from the menu, but I was not interested in trying anything else. She was very apologetic and we assured her it wasn't her fault. When we received our bill Serena had removed the charge for my entree and said she couldn't charge us for something we didn't eat.
When we left, a musical duo was just starting to perform in the lounge, and they sounded great.
The Dog seems like a fun place to go and hang out, have a drink and listen to music... but maybe the menu is targeted for children. I'm not sure. Overall, our waitress and service was good, and one of us had a great meal. We might return there again for the entertainment, but we will never order a chicken dinner again!
Visited August 2011 Value Atmosphere
Service Food
